intro: Polysphaeria squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose polysphaeria, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence. It is a flowering plant that typically grows in temperate regions, often found in grassy areas or along roadsides. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are usually finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. While not widely cultivated, it plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
